VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {7} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Chirper relative to the peak of FaceLink in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Chirper is to the {right} of the peak of FaceLink.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing ProfConnect show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing ProfConnect shows a {Periodic fluctuation}.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {SnapFrame} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =1.2?
EVJ.A: At X =1.2,the label with the highest density is {SnapFrame}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 8? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: GhostPic or FaceLink?
NC.A: {GhostPic} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: FaceLink or Chirper?
NC.A: {Chirper} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {4} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {SnapFrame}
